questions.question: What is retrieval practice?
questions.explanation: Retrieval practice strengthens memory by actively pulling information from your mind without looking.

questions.question: Which method supports retrieval practice?
questions.explanation: Practice quizzes are a great way to engage in retrieval by forcing the brain to recall answers without cues.

questions.question: How does retrieval practice help long-term memory?
options: It strengthens neural pathways through repeated recall
It reduces the need to review material
It stores information in short-term memory only
questions.explanation: Actively recalling information reinforces the memory trace and improves retention over time.

questions.question: What should you do after retrieving information incorrectly?
options: Revisit the material and try again
questions.explanation: Revisiting and correcting mistakes is part of the learning process and helps solidify the right information.

questions.question: Why is retrieval practice more effective than rereading?
options: It reduces study time to zero
It adds more content to your notes
It requires active effort, which enhances learning
It helps organize your documents better
questions.explanation: Retrieval activates memory and strengthens learning through effortful recall, unlike passive rereading.
